At first the 3D interface is going to be a menu with static/dynamic text and other objects. Once I implement scrollable menus and sub menus this will seem a lot more feasible. At this stage it may be a little while before this feature would happen though.

Once the base plugin is complete making extensions for it will be simple - and I hope other modders think about adding 'specific' menus to the 3d gui.

@BlazingAngel665: I wrote the material, shader, texture replacement code last night and now I just need to write the reflection shader - or we could use a cubemap (predefined reflection) and one of unity's shaders.

Could that display videos for tutorials or in game scenario videos?

Yes this is a definite planned feature.

Yes this is a definite planned feature.

Nice, would there be a way to make them triggered events?

If you approached something like the pyramid on Duna or an abandoned probe, it triggers a video to play.

Sure!

On the other part you would need to create a collider (usually box collider) with isTrigger set to true.

If you want event locations then I could add a module to the plugin to detect when the projection being touched by the 'event-collider'. You would add the module to your part config that would contain the path to the video to play.

That's my idea on it at least.

I have a lot of plans for this plugin, the most exciting to a lot of modders will probably be the extensibility that is going to be implemented.

Modders will be able to implement their own code into (and onto) the interface.

This plugin is still in the first design phase. Once I'm done with initial design I will release a version for testing and continue work on it.
